debt.title: More Americans expect to miss a debt payment in the months ahead: What that does to your credit score
debt.description: One missed payment could ding a credit score by about 80 points, on average, according to a new report by LendingTree.

debt.title: Over 800,000 student loan borrowers remain in backlog for forgiveness, affordable repayment plans
debt.description: More than 800,000 federal student loan holders remain stuck in a backlog of applications for an affordable repayment plan or debt forgiveness.

debt.title: With Trump taking aim at credit card rates, now is the best time to improve your credit score
debt.description: Regardless of what happens to the proposed credit card interest rate cap, a better credit score gets you access to better rates.

debt.title: Trump floats 1-year, 10% credit card interest rate cap — what that could mean for your money
debt.description: President Donald Trump called for a 10% cap on credit card interest rates. Here's what experts say that could mean for cardholders, if implemented.

economy.title: Fed's main gauge shows inflation at 2.8% in November, edging further away from target
economy.description: Inflation drifted slightly further from the Federal Reserve's target in November though in line with expectations.

economy.title: Trump says inflation was 'defeated.' Some economists disagree
economy.description: President Donald Trump said the U.S. "defeated" inflation and reined in consumer prices over the past year. Federal data suggests otherwise.

taxes.title: Student loan borrowers in default may miss out on Trump's 'largest tax refund season of all time'
taxes.description: The Trump administration is predicting larger tax refunds for the 2026 tax season, but the millions of student loan borrowers in default may miss out.

taxes.title: Republicans want to end the ‘marriage penalty’ for this childcare tax credit
taxes.description: The Republican framework for "Reconciliation 2.0" includes an expansion for the child and dependent care tax credit. Here's what families need to know.

taxes.title: Bigger tax refunds are coming for 2026 — what it could mean for the economy
taxes.description: Bigger tax refunds could be coming in 2026 due to changes enacted in President Donald Trump's "big beautiful bill." Here's how it could impact the economy.

investing.title: How tax-efficient investing could boost your portfolio returns in 2026 and beyond
investing.description: Now is the time to consider how changes in tax law, along with tax-efficient investing strategies, can boost your portfolio.

investing.title: Retail traders keep their hot streak going, buying Tuesday’s dip while Wall Street drove ‘Sell America’ trade
investing.description: Individual traders boosted the stock market by continuing to buy the latest selloff — the same strategy that helped power relentless gains in 2025, data shows.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 22: Markets Surge Again Today After Greenland Tariffs Are Dropped
investing.description: Tariff relief on Greenland-linked trade sparked a broad rebound in clean-energy names and tech-heavy benchmarks, today, Jan. 22, 2026.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 22: Huntington Bancshares Falls After Missing Revenue and EPS Estimates
investing.description: On Jan. 22, 2026, investors weigh Huntington’s earnings miss against rising net interest income and its high-profile Southern U.S. expansion plans.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 22: Plug Power Jumps on CEO Reddit Q&A Addressing Funding and Walmart Agreement Update
investing.description: Retail traders parse fresh funding talk, a Walmart pact, and a cautious Wall Street reset for this hydrogen player, today, Jan. 22, 2026.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 22: Netflix Drops as Guidance Tempers Strong Q4 Results
investing.description: Today, Jan. 22, 2026, investors are weighing blockbuster subscriber and revenue growth against cautious guidance and a massive Warner bid.
